episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a range of quirky and fascinating topics, including a shouting bomb developed by America in 1957, a library book returned 100 years late, the invention of crowd control barriers due to a giant balloon, and Volkswagen's surprising sausage sales surpassing their car sales.

facts.fact: In 1957, America developed a shouting bomb that would lecture the enemy for three minutes as it dropped from the sky.
Earlier this year, a book called '40 Minutes Late' was returned to a library in San Francisco 100 years late.
The person who invented crowd control barriers did so because so many people were flocking to see his giant balloon.
Volkswagen sells more sausages than cars.
